content.rendered:
It seems that peace, like many things, is in short supply. Peoples and nations are either in the midst of war or are either threatening or being threatened by another. It’s easy to forget the human toll of those who are being affected by these wars.

Each of us longs for peace. We want peace for our nation and peace for our souls. Yet, it is only in Jesus, the Prince of Peace, that we can actually find peace. The wounds of Jesus can heal us and it is by his blood that we are made clean. It’s only through faith in Jesus that we can see the Father.

“For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God.” — Romans 3:23 (KJV)

“For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.” — John 3:13 (KJV)

Ephesians 2:8-9 (KJV) tells us, “For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:Not of works, lest any man should boast.”

We can look inside for peace. We can negotiate for peace. One day, Jesus will come, and he will put an end to all fighting. Until then, we can at least find peace with God the Father though faith in Jesus.

It’s pretty simple. Faith often asks us to do simple things and it’s often the simple things that are the hardest. A simple prayer like, “Father, forgive my sins,” may be all it takes if it is said in faith.

Real peace will come to the world one day. Till then, we can have a peace with God though his son, Jesus. I hope you find peace.
